=== Current Issues ===
* sound does not work after suspend (see note 1)
* adjusting brightness with driver 'nvidia' fails (see note 2)
* Lid close is not detected
* sound recording through internal mic isn't possible (see note 4,5)

==== Notes ====
* '''note 1'''<<BR>>
 the sound doesn't work after resume from standby (suspend to ram)<<BR>>
 workaround:
  1. stop the sound deamon ('artsd' under KDE)
  2. run<pre>
sudo rmmod snd_hda_intel
sudo modprobe snd_hda_intel}}}
  3. restart the sound deamon
* '''note 2'''<<BR>>
 driver 'nv' (xserver-xorg-video-nv 1:2.1.8-1ubuntu1):
** adjusting brightness through Fn+up/down works fine but without 3D acceleration
 driver 'nvidia' (nvidia-glx-new 169.12+2.6.24.12-16.34):
** display brightness is always at minimum level after boot<<BR>>
** when booting with AC adapter plugged in the display switches from max. brightness to min. brightness when the bootmessage <code> * Loading hardware drivers...</code> <<BR>>
  is displayed<<BR>>
** after resume from standby (suspend to ram) the brightness is at maximum level<<BR>>
** brightness adjustment isn't possible when driver 'nvidia' is loaded<<BR>>
  this seems to be a known problem at NVidia (http://www.nvnews.net/vbulletin/showthread.php?t=100494) <<BR>>
  workaround:
   1. switch to an other vt (e.g. Ctrl+Alt+F6)
   2. run{{{
sudo sh -c "echo -n <level> > /proc/acpi/video/NVID/LCD/brightness"
</pre>
   where <level> is 0, 10, 25, 40, 55, 70, 85 or 100
* '''note 4'''<<BR>>
 channel 'Mic' (Mic Jack) is always used as source for recording no matter what channel was selected (tested with audacity and gnome-sound-recorder; alsa-lib 1.0.15-3ubuntu4)
* '''note 5'''<<BR>>
 passing channel 'front Mic' (Internal Mic) to the speakers through KMix (enable output channel 'Front Mic') works.
* '''note 6'''<<BR>>
 input channel 'capture 1' has to be enabled for recording
